info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 10:06AM EDT until April 17 at 4:16AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana...
Wabash River.
Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
.Lowland flooding has developed along the length of the Wabash River due to rainfall of generally three to eight inches in the Wabash basin. Significant flooding is expected to develop on the lower Wabash from Riverton down through Mount Carmel. The crest on the Wabash was approaching Covington and Montezuma Monday morning and is expected to reach Riverton Thursday morning and Mount Carmel on Sunday.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wabash River at Vincennes.
* WHEN...Until Thursday, April 17.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Almost all unprotected areas flood. River cabins are surrounded by high water. Oil fields in lowland areas are inaccessible by land vehicles. Most local river roads flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Monday /8:45 AM CDT Monday/ the stage was 19.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EDT Monday /8:45 AM CDT Monday/ was 19.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday, April 16. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 600 PM EDT /500 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, APRIL 17

area.areaDesc: Lawrence, IL; Wabash, IL; Knox, IN
